borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<div>The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in a harmful loss of outlook and daylight resulting in a overbearing impact to neighbouring dwellings especially No 155 Westrow Drive, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:</div><div><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style=""><br></span></div><ul><li><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="">Paragraph 130(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC,&nbsp; July 2021)</li><li>Policy
D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);</li><li> Policy
CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li>Paragraph 5.3.3 of the Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:7.5pt;line-height:normal">The siting,&nbsp;width, scale,&nbsp;and design of the proposed first floor extension would result in the closure of the architectural gap between the application site and the neighbouring
property at No 155 Westrow Drive which contributes a vital sense of openness to
the streetscene. The development is considered harmful to the character of the
area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to: -&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Paragraph 126 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021) </li><li>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)&nbsp;</li><li> Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)&nbsp;</li><li> Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </li><li>Paragraph 5.4.2(a) of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012) </li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<br></li></ul>
description: Demolition of garage, construction of a two storey side extension and single storey rear extension
